channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024021129
item.description:
Report X-2024021129

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION 2 OUT OF 4 BOTTLES OF ACETONITRILE WAS FOUND CRACKED AND LEAKED OUT THE REMAINING 2 HAD NO DAMAGE. THEY WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF ACETONITRILE CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report E-2024020390
item.description:
Report E-2024020390

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: KEARNY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 9, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of NA1993 was punctured in transit due to no dunnage and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel secured the damaged tote and proceeded to transfer the NA1993 to one (1) new 330-gallon poly tote that was fitted with the appropriate labels for further shipment and processing. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the released product in the trailer and swept them in with hand tools. The one (1) empty and damaged tote was cut up with hand tools. Two (2) 55-gallon poly drums of spent absorbents, PPE, the cut-up tote, and any cleanup debris were generated as waste and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report X-2024021005
item.description:
Report X-2024021005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at Hazmat location with signs of external damages. The package was inspected, and signs of internal leakage was found. Two of the contents leaked out. One was found without a cap and the other with a very loose cap. The remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The package failure came about due to a missing cap from one bottle and a loose cap from another. One of the bottles leaked out in its entirety and the other bottle leaked out approximately 1/16 of its content. No holes or punctures were found on either of the bottles that leaked. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: All contents were immediately inspected, caps were replaced and tightened and placed in a lined salvage drum to prevent any further leakage or damages.

Package was immediately placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing. DescribePack: Contents shifted in shipping box causing one of three WeberClean Concentrated Soaking Solution 1Gal bottles to have loose cap. item.title: Report X-2024020378
item.description:
Report X-2024020378

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered in the damaged hazmat area after completing processing hazmat. The package was removed from the system flow, due to leakage. The bottles were in a yellow salvage drum with no outer packaging. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was discovered six bottles of LabChem hydrochloric acid in plastic bottles 2.5 liters. One of the bottles had a loose cap with caused spillage. The bottles were left in a yellow salvage drum with only the tracking id attached. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024020357
item.description:
Report X-2024020357

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 2X5 LITERS (PLASTIC BOTTLES) RAPICIDE PA HIGH LEVEL DISINFECTANT PART A AND 2X5 LITERS (PLASTIC BOTTLES) RAPICIDE PA HIGH LEVEL DISINFECTANT PART B. THE RAPICIDE PA HIGH LEVEL DISINFECTANT PART A EACH HAD LOOSE CAPS CAUSING LEAKAGING ALLOWING 20 OUNCES OF SPILLAGE FROM EACH BOTTLE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024020339
item.description:
Report X-2024020339

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking by the driver upon his return to the station after completing the pickup. Package was placed into a salvage drum to contain the spillage. DescribePack: The package was removed from the system flow, due to leakage. Upon inspection of the plastic pail containing NALCO WATER UN1719 CAUSTIC ALKALI, N.O.S. 8 gallons, a small puncture hole that triggered a slow leakage of contents. It appears the pail was punctured by a sharp object on the truck. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024020784
item.description:
Report X-2024020784

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024020784 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 1/2 CUP LEAKED FROM ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES DUE TO IT HAVING A LOOSE CAP. DescribePack: ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES INSIDE THE PACKAGE HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING APPROXIMATELY 1/2 CUP OF LIQUID TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE THEN IMMEDIATELY CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK THE PRODUCTS INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. X-2024020785-SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND RIPPED. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK THE PRODUCTS INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 3 LITERS LEAKED OUT FROM PART B DUE TO IT HAVING A LOOSE CAP. AWAITING THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: ONE OF FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING APPROXIMATELY 3 LITERS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING PACKAGE OVER THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY AND THEN IMMEDIATELY CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY MANNER.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipping box crushed and torn while in transit causing three of four ReliaChem Smokehouse Cleaner Heavy Duty Foaming Cleaner 1Gal bottles to have loose caps. Package was immediately placed in RED Tote and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing. DescribePack: Shipping box crushed and torn while in transit causing three of four ReliaChem Smokehouse Cleaner Heavy Duty Foaming Cleaner 1Gal bottles to have loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in RED Tote and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2024020311
item.description:
Report X-2024020311

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-12
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking by the driver upon his return to the station after completing the pickup. Package was placed into a salvage drum to contain the spillage. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 2X5 LITERS (PLASTIC BOTTLES) RAPICIDE PA HIGH LEVEL DISINFECTANT PART A AND 2X5 LITERS (PLASTIC BOTTLES) RAPICIDE PA HIGH LEVEL DISINFECTANT PART B ONE HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING LEAKAGING ALLOWING 20 OUNCES OF SPILLAGE FROM THE BOTTLE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM THE TRUCK AND IT WAS NOTICED THE BOX WAS WET. PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT CAGE, SECURED AND REPACKED IN A SALVAGE DRUM.
